intro: Gonostegia triandra, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark brown wood that is highly valued for its fragrance and durability. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by dark, glossy berries that contain the seeds. Gonostegia triandra is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
